section.heading: Direct Exclusion Through Fantasy Competition Operator.

para.text: An individual may request exclusion from entering a fantasy competition by submitting to the fantasy competition operator a self-exclusion request using a self-exclusion tool provided by the fantasy competition operator on its website.
A fantasy competition operator shall implement and prominently display procedures for players to self-exclude themselves.
Self-excluded persons may not collect any prizes or recover any losses arising as result of any prohibited participation in a fantasy competition operator’s fantasy competition.
A request for exclusion submitted to a fantasy competition operator:
Is not an application for voluntary exclusion through the Commission under COMAR 36.01.03;
Will not result in inclusion on the Commission’s Voluntary Exclusion List; and
Is not administered or maintained by the Commission.
A fantasy competition operator shall establish a responsible gaming plan that includes at least the following elements:
Goals;
Procedures and deadlines for implementation;
Identification of personnel responsible for implementation;
Responsibilities of personnel identified as responsible for implementation;
Training for personnel on problem gambling and identifying compulsive play;
Means of educating fantasy competition players about:
Problem gambling, including compulsive play; and
Problem gambling treatment resources, including treatment and prevention programs;
Placement of responsible gambling awareness materials on the fantasy competition platform; and
Any other element required by the Commission.
A fantasy competition operator shall submit to the Commission the responsible gaming plan required under §A of this regulation for review and approval.
A fantasy competition operator shall submit any amendments to a responsible gaming plan to the Commission prior to implementation.
A fantasy competition operator shall submit to the Commission an annual report describing the operation of the responsible gaming plan.
A fantasy competition operator shall:
Prevent the participation in fantasy competitions by individuals who have self-excluded themselves from entering fantasy competitions; and
Train employees on compulsive play.

A fantasy competition operator may not market a contest by phone, text, email, or knowingly directing any form of individually targeted advertisement or marketing material to an individual if the individual is self-excluded or otherwise barred from playing in that fantasy competition.
